attributes.action: Tax excessive profits made from government Covid contracts.
attributes.additional_details: “The profiteering that cannot be got at by the restraints of conscience and love of country can be got at by taxation.” – US President Woodrow Wilson, 1918.
attributes.background:
During a period of emergency contracts were given that enabled excessive profits to be made. This took advantage of the nation as a whole.
The UK government introduced excessive profits tax legislation in both the First and Second World Wars.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/596649
